question:
What is the time complexity of binary search on a sorted array of n elements?

A) O(n)
B) O(log n)
C) O(n log n)
D) O(1)
E) O(log log n)

A function f(n) satisfies f(n) = 2f(n/2) + n for n > 1 and f(1) = 1. What is the asymptotic time complexity of f(n)?

A) O(n)
B) O(n log n)
C) O(log n)
D) O(n^2)
E) O(1)

A box contains 3 red balls and 2 blue balls. Two balls are drawn at random without replacement. What is the probability that both balls are red?

A) 1/10
B) 3/10
C) 1/5
D) 3/5
E) 2/5

In propositional logic, which of the following formulas is logically equivalent to ¬(A ∧ B)?

A) ¬A ∧ ¬B
B) A ∨ B
C) ¬A ∨ ¬B
D) A → ¬B
E) ¬(A ∨ B)

An investment guarantees a return of 5% with certainty, while another offers a 50% chance of 12% return and a 50% chance of 0% return. Assuming risk neutrality, which option should be chosen?

A) The guaranteed 5% return
B) The probabilistic investment
C) Both are equally preferable
D) Neither is rationally acceptable
E) Cannot be determined without more data

In a directed graph, which condition guarantees that the graph is acyclic?

A) The graph has no nodes with degree zero
B) The graph is strongly connected
C) A topological ordering exists
D) The graph has an even number of nodes
E) All nodes have the same degree

According to classical mechanics, which quantity is conserved in an isolated system with no external forces?

A) Velocity
B) Acceleration
C) Linear momentum
D) Position
E) Kinetic energy only

If all mammals are warm-blooded and all whales are mammals, which conclusion logically follows?

A) All warm-blooded animals are whales
B) Some mammals are not whales
C) All whales are warm-blooded
D) Some warm-blooded animals are not mammals
E) No whales are cold-blooded mammals

In a market with perfectly inelastic demand, how does an increase in supply affect equilibrium price?

A) Price increases
B) Price decreases
C) Price remains unchanged
D) Quantity decreases
E) Market equilibrium disappears

A system outputs a warning signal if either sensor A or sensor B fails. Sensor A fails with probability 0.1, sensor B with probability 0.2, independently. What is the probability that the system outputs a warning?

A) 0.02
B) 0.10
C) 0.20
D) 0.28
E) 0.30
